intro: Boehmeria caudata var. lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flax, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India, China, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fibers of its stems are used in traditional crafts and textiles, highlighting its economic and cultural significance.
